mathling

Class MathlingMutator

  • java.lang.Object
    • mathling.MathlingMutator

  • public class MathlingMutator
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of useful functions for mutating and generating Mathlings.

      • randMinMax

        public static double randMinMax(double lower,
                                double upper)
        Returns a double between two values.
        Parameters:
        lower - The lower bound to generate between.
        upper - The upper bound to generate between.
        Returns:
        The randomly-generated, bounded double.

      • newExpressionSafe

        public static Expression newExpressionSafe(double[] odds)
        This gets around the StackOverflowError by repeatedly retrying the function until it works.

        Note: This does affect the probability! Odds of [0.1, 0.1] will almost certainly overflow, and further repeats will almost certainly repeat until the first Expression generated is either a number or a variable. Therefore in this case, the probability of a complex Expression is almost 0% instead of the expected 99.8%. Increase the odds of the former two if this ends up happening.

        Testing still needs to be done to find the optimal odds for generation of complex Expressions.
        Parameters:
        odds - The probabilities to attempt to match. See newExpressionUnsafe(double[]) for more details.
        Returns:
        The safely-generated Expression.
        See Also:
        Expression, newExpressionUnsafe(double[])

      • pokeExpression

        public static Expression pokeExpression(Expression e,
                                        double aggressiveness)
        A "poke" is a chance to change one or more of an Expression's numerical nodes while leaving the structure of the tree fully intact.
        Parameters:
        e - The Expression to poke.
        aggressiveness - How likely it will be to poke any found number node.
        Returns:
        The poked (Expression.
        See Also:
        Expression, mutateExpression(Expression, double, double[])

      • mutateExpression

        public static Expression mutateExpression(Expression e,
                                          double aggressiveness,
                                          double[] odds)
        Unlike a poke, a full mutation does have a chance of (perhaps dramatically) altering the structure of an Expression.
        Parameters:
        e - The Expression to mutate.
        aggressiveness - How likely this is to be just a poke, and if it is a mutation, how likely each node is to be the point of mutation. An aggressiveness of 100% will always mutate the root node, effectively creating an entirely new Expression. Alternatively, an aggressiveness of 0% will always alter a terminal node, thereby minimally altering the Expression.
        odds - The odds to generate a new Expression with. See newExpressionUnsafe(double[]) for more details.
        Returns:
        The mutated Expression.
        See Also:
        pokeExpression(Expression, double), Expression, newExpressionUnsafe(double[])
